texts.definition: Controlling the movement of game elements in real-time games.
markups: <style="Definition">Controlling the movement of game elements in real-time games.</style>

Moving game elements in games are common, but doing so in real-time games require different skills than in turn-based ones. This type of movement, <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style>, requires players to pay constant attention to what happens in the game and react to these with the appropriate timing.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Racing%20Games">Racing Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Need%20for%20Speed%20series">Need for Speed series</link></style> and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Gran%20Turismo%20series">Gran Turismo series</link></style> requires players to maneuver cars as quickly as possible around courses. The racing games in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/F-Zero%20series">F-Zero</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Wipeout%20series">Wipeout series</link></style> also requires player to maneuver vehicles to avoid obstacles and other vehicles but does this at even high speeds and on tracks making full use of three dimensions.

Much of the skill in playing <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">First-Person Shooters</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield series</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Halo%20series">Halo series</link></style>, and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style> consists in being able to maneuver <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style>, and vehicles they have entered, so one has good opportunities to attack enemies while still avoiding their attacks.

In the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Assassin's%20Creed%20series">Assassin's Creed series</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Super%20Mario%20series">Super Mario series</link></style>, and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tomb%20Raider%20series">Tomb Raider series</link></style> players need to navigate the game environment by timing running, jumping, and other movement actions to a high degree.

<style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> is basically <style="Link"><link="movement">Movement</link></style> in <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style>, and can be necessary either due to wanting to reach certain locations (e.g. winning <style="Link"><link="races">Races</link></style>) or due to wishing to avoid other game elements that move. The specifics of <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> generally affect this but some patterns are more likely to have strong effects on <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style>, with <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/The%20Show%20Must%20Go%20On">The Show Must Go On</link></style> being the most important since it means that players may not be able to ignore performing the <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style>. Of the two cases, <style="Link"><link="evade">Evade</link></style> can be used in the first case to make players with to avoid <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> due to from collisions while <style="Link"><link="chargers">Chargers</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="pick-ups">Pick-Ups</link></style> can be used to create <style="Link"><link="collecting">Collecting</link></style> goals. In the second case, <style="Link"><link="movement">Movement</link></style> of <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style>, or shots from them, can make <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> more important due to the presence of <style="Link"><link="evade">Evade</link></style> goals; the same applies to <style="Link"><link="ultra-powerful-events">Ultra-Powerful Events</link></style>, e.g., raising bridges or rock falls, that can be perceived and avoided. The importance of <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> can also be affected due to goals to <style="Link"><link="capture">Capture</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="herd">Herd</link></style> something, or when the <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> is part of attempting actions concerning <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style> offer ways to change the way <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> is done temporary or over time as gameplay progresses and this can be emphasized by the presence of dedicated <style="Link"><link="vehicle-sections">Vehicle Sections</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> requires that players have some level of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Spatial%20Engrossment">Spatial Engrossment</link></style> in the game and this typically requires either <style="Link"><link="first-person-views">First-Person Views</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="third-person-views">Third-Person Views</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="challenging-gameplay">Challenging Gameplay</link></style> can quite easily be achieved for <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> through the specifics of these views, the speed of game elements (see <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/F-Zero%20GX">F-Zero GX</link></style> and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Wipeout%20series">Wipeout series</link></style> for examples of this), and the number the number of <style="Link"><link="obstacles">Obstacles</link></style>, and other game elements (including other players) that players need to take into consideration. The first raises the requirements on skills in <style="Link"><link="dexterity-based-actions">Dexterity-Based Actions</link></style> while the second requires <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attention%20Swapping">Attention Swapping</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> is a <style="Link"><link="dexterity-based-actions">Dexterity-Based Action</link></style> that often requires <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Timing">Timing</link></style>, especially when players are given <style="Link"><link="capture">Capture</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="evade">Evade</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="herd">Herd</link></style> goals. This makes for <style="Link"><link="attention-demanding-gameplay">Attention Demanding Gameplay</link></style> which can give <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Spatial%20Engrossment">Spatial Engrossment</link></style> since players must think of the positions of their <style="Link"><link="focus-loci">Focus Loci</link></style> in relation to <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>. Like other forms of <style="Link"><link="movement">Movement</link></style>, it is quite likely to provide players with a <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style>.

The <style="CurrentLink">Maneuvering</style> of <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> are likely to make <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style> actions more difficult.
